page.title: 18Attington Stud
page.content: Attington Stud is a 120 acre stud farm on the Tetsworth to Postcombe road. It was built in 1742 as two cottages but through the years it has been extended into a large mansion. Within the grounds is accomodation for the families who work on the estate. Horses bred on the estate are for the flat races. There are some twenty five horses altogether at the stud, five of which are brood mares. So far, the stud has yet to produce a famous racehorse, although the dam of a well-known one is now kept there. The horses have won at least twelve races between them. The foals are sold to stables all over the country. They are sold as yearlings. When the horses need new shoes they are taken to the blacksmiths in Thame.
